title: Soraka Buff

Hey Meddler, I don't know if it's working as intended or not but I had two games last night where I was Soraka against an Anivia. Anytime I'd drop Equinox on Anivia, or she'd step into the pool... It wouldn't cancel/shut Glacial Storm off. Is this working as intended? Because it kind of bothers me that Malzahar's and Cho's silence will cancel her ult but Equinox will not.

No, that's not intended. Not sure what's going on there, a quick look at the spells in question suggests everything's set up properly. I'll bounce that on to the designer who worked on the Soraka rework last year, see if he's got any ideas.

Not to be too much of a thread hi-jacker, but do you think you could forward something else? I'd think it'd be a nice QoL buff if, when mousing over Soraka's passive, the range indicator would be shown on the mini-map as well. 

As it is currently, the range usually goes outside the camera's boundaries, and it'd be nice to know just how close you need to get before the passive kicks in, especially if you chose to use locked camera (I don't use locked camera, but it'd still be nice to just glance at the mini-map for it.).
It is the size of your icon on the minimap I think. I get the boost usually when it overlaps

Is it really? For her passive? I'll need to look at that, but I'd think 2500~ range would be bigger than that on the minimap.

EDIT: Maybe we're thinking of something else? I checked in a custom game, and the range is about the size of the camera's range, which on the minimap, the boundaries are definitely bigger than the champion icon.
Thanks for that. Yeah I would love to be able to see the passive on the mini map. Or even the range of low health allies to get the boost

While looking at Equinox, could you also forward a look at its interaction with Katarina. There seems to be a bug where Katarina can restart her ultimate inside Equinox when getting a reset on her abilities (I've also occasionally seen her Shunpo out of Equinox, I'm guessing this is related to resets as well).

I've read some theories from the bug threads where this has been reported about this having to do with Equinox being handled as a reapplying silence dot every 0.x sec and getting a reset in between these allows a cast inside Equinox. Don't know myself but I saw it happen in just about every game of Hexakill last fall when I played Soraka.

No, my statistics with {{champion:16}} and the Record Times for heals then go for seconds when up against Graves{{champion:104}}, Zyra {{champion:143}}, and Cassiopeia {{champion:69}} . Really, this is beyond timing of those three hitting me in a bombardment, more with the second I could have there was no damage and my spells were live amplifies and ready. Intermediate level. From FuryofThornsRedo

How about if a {{champion:16}}  spell hits one enemy, then any other enemy near by in light range is subject to a spell cast onto them specifically as well {so they cannot run over them unaffected} and are then reduce to their game start level of skills for a duration of 3-5 seconds? Might end up in the boundary confinement of up to four targets only as some of your items already have confined the boundary lines? Though to own the 5 targets ability {{champion:16}} must be engaged in battles on the enemy home base territory turret inhibitors battle grounds? Though how this spell could help fight the Legendary Dragon might have less affect there. From FuryofThornsRedo
